00016 
00017 void
00018 ctools::time::HighResClock::getTime(::ctools::time::HighResTime& hrtime)
00019 {
00020     // Here I use the RDTSC instruction provided by the Pentium
00021     // Processor family to access the clock counter. To avoid problem
00022     // with out of order execution, and to make sure that the clock
00023     // cycle number is accessed really where the call appears in the
00024     // source code a cpuid instruction is added. 
00025     //    
00026     //   unsigned long cpuid;
00027     unsigned long long int rdtsc;
00028     __asm__ volatile (".byte 0x0f, 0x31" : "=A" (rdtsc));
00029 
00030     // Convert clock number into nano seconds
00031     long double timeNS = rdtsc * CLOCK_PERIOD_NS;
00032 
00033     long cMilliSec = static_cast<long>(timeNS/POW_6_TEN);
00034     long cNanoSec = static_cast<long>(timeNS - (cMilliSec*POW_6_TEN));
00035 
00036     hrtime.set(cMilliSec, cNanoSec);
00037 }
00038

00041 double
00042 ctools::time::HighResClock::getClockFrequency ()
00043 {
00044     double clockFreq = CLOCK_FREQUENCY;
00045     double freq = static_cast<double>(clockFreq);
00046     
00047     return freq;
00048 }
00049 
00050 double
00051 ctools::time::HighResClock::getClockPeriod ()
00052 {
00053   double period = CLOCK_PERIOD_NS;
00054   double jp = static_cast<double>(period);
00055   return jp;
00056 }
00057 
00058 unsigned long long
00059 ctools::time::HighResClock::getClockTickCount ()
00060 {
00061     unsigned long long int cpuid;
00062     unsigned long long int rdtsc;
00063     __asm__ volatile ("cpuid" : "=A" (cpuid));
00064     __asm__ volatile (".byte 0x0f, 0x31" : "=A" (rdtsc));
00065     return rdtsc;
00066 }
